intro: Arnebia lindbergiana subsp. paphmanica, commonly known as the Paphlagonian arnebia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves. The plant produces striking red or pink flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
